meanings.definition: The line of seaweed, debris, and other materials left by the high tide on a beach.
meanings.sent1: At the strandline, you can find various treasures washed up by the sea.
meanings.sent2: The children played near the strandline, collecting shells and driftwood.
meanings.sent3: The seagull danced along the strandline, looking for a tasty snack.
meanings.sent4: The strandline resembled a natural border between the land and the sea.
meanings.sent5: The colorful seaweed at the strandline painted a beautiful picture on the sand.

meanings.definition: To leave or drive (a boat, sailor, etc.) aground or ashore on a strand.
meanings.sent1: The storm forced the sailors to strandline their boat on the shore.
meanings.sent2: The captain carefully navigated the ship to strandline it safely on the beach.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous pirates decided to strandline their ship as a prank.
meanings.sent4: The decision to strandline the vessel was a last resort in the rough waters.
meanings.sent5: The sailors had to strandline the boat to avoid crashing into the rocks.

meanings.definition: To drive or leave (a boat, sailor, etc.) aground or ashore on a strand.
meanings.sent1: The fisherman had to strandline his boat due to engine failure.
meanings.sent2: The strong currents threatened to strandline the small sailboat on the sandbar.
meanings.sent3: The tourists accidentally strandlined their kayak while exploring the coast.
meanings.sent4: The old sailor shared stories of how he once had to strandline his ship during a storm.
meanings.sent5: The captain skillfully strandlined the vessel to avoid a collision with the pier.
